definitions.definition: A period of the ecclesiastical year preceding Easter, traditionally involving temporary abstention from certain foods and pleasures.
definitions.example: Hezekiah gave up vaping for Lent.

definitions.definition: The second term of the academic year at some British schools.
To allow to be used by someone temporarily, on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned.
definitions.example: I lent her 10 euros to pay for the train tickets, and she paid me back the next day.

definitions.definition: To be suitable or applicable, to fit.
definitions.example: Poems do not lend themselves to translation easily.

definitions.definition: To afford; to grant or furnish in general.
definitions.example: Can you lend me some assistance?
